description.narrative: This project promotes the development of a regional early warning, detection, surveillance and management system in southern African countries for fruit fly pests of concern. The effort includes strengthening regional communication among national plant protection organizations. Developing this network will ultimately help participating countries with food security and trade opportunities.

Commodity Credit Corporation Fund

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

description.narrative: The McGovern-Dole program provides for the donation of agricultural commodities and the provision of financial and technical assistance to improve the education, food security and health of school-age children, especially girls, in developing countries.

description.narrative: The McGovern-Dole program provides for the donation of agricultural commodities and the provision of financial and technical assistance to improve the education, food security and health of school-age children, especially girls, in developing countries.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses
Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Local and Regional Food Aid Procurement Pilot Project

description.narrative: The Local and Regional Food Aid Procurement Project (USDA LRP Project) was authorized as a pilot program under the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (Farm Bill). The primary purpose of the USDA LRP Project is to examine the timeliness and efficiency of local and regional procurement (LRP) as a tool to enhance USG food assistance programs.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: McGovern-Dole International Food for Education and Child Nutrition Program Grants

description.narrative: A team from Michigan State University is continuing work in Mozambique on a Land Tenure Services project, aiming to establish more efficient and secure access to land by improving the policy and regulatory framework and helping beneficiaries meet their immediate needs for registered land rights and better access to land for investment.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles
